instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S0SW_LCD: What is PP3V3_S0SW_LCD? PP3V3_S0SW_LCD is a 3.3v power rail necessary to power the image circuitry on the screen. This is necessary to get a picture on the screen. .
definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Hi.

I have this laptop which the client said the screen was showing purple lines on screen when on 45' angle but since he got it here the laptop didn't show picture at all only backlight. I measured j8500 and on pin 6 with diode mode the value seems high 1.600 so i followed the line to <RESISTOR>R0557</RESISTOR> which should be 100k but when measured on the board it's 47k. I removed it and it's 100k when not soldered and the value on board stays the same. <RESISTOR>R4830</RESISTOR> it's measuring fine. Any ideas please? 

Thanks :D

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Flexgate

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Check if Apple can still change the screen for free.

Onboard mesurements for high value resistors, almost never show the nominal value; is normal, depending by other components.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Ok thanks looks like an lcd issue. If i replace the full flex should be fine i think. I'll advise the client :)

Good day  :D

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Hey guys. Not an lcd issue i got a new one and power on no image, would appreciate some assistance :)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Did you check full LCD assembly?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Yes full lcd assembly i got brand new

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: I'm measuring now and on the backlight circuit on <TRANSISTOR>Q8400</TRANSISTOR> i have voltage on <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLT_R</SIGNAL> and on contacts 1,2,5,6 nothing. I'll keep measuring the components and update... There no Image if anyone wanna ask :)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Nothing wrong with backlight circuit components seems like <TRANSISTOR>Q8400</TRANSISTOR> it's not opening

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
If no image present, no reason to search for backlight.
Backlight appears after image get stable, to avoid any artifacts on the screen.

Check first if you get external video, or at least USB activity.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Yes there is External video working fine

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
"Brand new" chinese?
Check again with original assembly.
If backlight comes on, there must be a problem with internal eDP data lines; if no image.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Brand new original and with the old that we had the last time it showed anything was lines ...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Check again with old one, to confirm you still get lines at least...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: I checked already not showing image and no backlight and on external runs perfect

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
If you don't get the lines like before, seems that LCD is not detected now.
Check if 3V3/<SIGNAL>5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> are present at J8500 at least; <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> should go high too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Thanks i'll check and update... Appreciate it

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> 3.4v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL>   5.15v
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> not going anywhere :D 0v with plugged screen

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Then the screen is not detected.
Test with known good working screen assembly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: I don't have another screen and the supplier has never sent a bad screen. Any other ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Bad video cable, connector, or PCH...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: i tried another 2 cables and the connector is without any damage on the board. I'l re check what lines are going to cpu/pch

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: On J8500 pin 6 <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> diode value is 1.5 and i took another board which is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a and it's 0.45 on the same pin same network and goes directly to cpu...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Both readings with red probe at ground?
If yes, there is a problem; possibly bad CPU, or solders.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Yes red probe on ground as it should be for diode mode reading. I check all resistors also replaced <RESISTOR>R4830</RESISTOR> cause on pin 1 which comes from pin 2 of <TRANSISTOR>Q4830</TRANSISTOR> it has 1.647 diode mode value and on pin 2 of <RESISTOR>R4830</RESISTOR> it has 0.568. I also replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q4830</TRANSISTOR> but no change. All leads to a contact under the CPU which probably broke cause of overheating

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: The issue comes probably from under cpu or bad cpu. The client will use it on external for now. Thanks for the help
